toolkitDocs__CSRAssRepo__CSRAssesmentRep: Sustainability is the continuing commitment to act responsibly by integrating social and environmental concerns into business operations. Sustainability goes beyond regulatory compliance to focus on how companies manage their economic, social and environmental impacts, as well as their relationships with stakeholders (e.g. employees, trading partners, government).

The EcoVadis methodology framework assesses companies' policies and actions as well as their published reporting related to the environment, labor and human rights, ethics and sustainable procurement. Our team of international sustainability experts analyze and crosscheck companies’ data (supporting documents, 360° Watch Findings, etc.) in order to create reliable ratings, taking into account each company’s industry, size and geographic location.

EcoVadis provides the leading solution for monitoring sustainability in global supply chains. Using innovative technology and sustainability expertise, we strive to engage companies and help them adopt sustainable practices.

No part of this document may be reproduced, modified or distributed in any form or manner without prior written permission from EcoVadis. EcoVadis does not guarantee the accuracy, reliability, completeness of the information, content, text, graphics provided on this document.

It enables companies to build an improvement plan online, communicate planned and completed corrective actions and share feedback. <company_name> has a corrective action plan in place and is working on improving their sustainability management system.
Get a clear picture of a company’s sustainability performance.

The scorecard is the final output of the EcoVadis assessment. It rates and benchmarks a company's sustainability performance in four themes on a scale of 0-100 and highlights strengths and improvement areas.
Know where a company stands compared to their industry.
Benchmark the company's sustainability performance against the industry with a score distribution graph and theme score comparisons.
Discover the primary sustainability risks, regulations, hot topics and best practices related to specific industries.
More and more companies raise questions about their trading partners' environmental and social performance. The EcoVadis assessment allows companies to demonstrate their commitment.
Companies with an EcoVadis Scorecard avoid audit fatigue by sharing one assessment with all requesting customers.
Procurement, CSR, EHS, and Sustainability leaders in enterprises looking to monitor sustainability risk in the supply chain request an EcoVadis assessment for their trading partners.
Based on a company's specific sustainability risk factors, a customized questionnaire is created. It contains 20 to 50 questions tailored to the industry, size and location.
Companies are required to provide supporting documentation for their answers to the questionnaire. These documents are reviewed by our analysts.
Company information that is publicly available, most often found on the company website, is also collected as evidence of their sustainability performance.
360° Watch Findings comprise relevant public information about companies' sustainability practices, identified via more than 10,000 data sources. They can have positive, negative or no score impact.
Our analysts combine all these elements to produce one unified scorecard per company.

EcoVadis assessments focus on 21 issues which are grouped into 4 themes (Environment, Labor & Human Rights, Ethics, Sustainable Procurement). The 21 issues or criteria are based upon international sustainability standards such as the Global Compact Principles, the International Labour Organization (ILO) conventions, the Global Reporting Initiative (GRI) standard, the ISO 26000 standard, and the CERES principles.

EcoVadis assessments evaluate a company's sustainability management system by looking at seven management indicators. These are used to further customize the assessment by weighting the four themes and their subsequent 21 sustainability criteria.

1. Policies: Mission statements, policies, objectives, targets, governance
2. Endorsement: Endorsement of external sustainability initiatives
3. Measures: Measures and actions implemented (e.g. procedures, training, equipment)
5. Coverage: Coverage of measures and actions
6. Reporting: Reporting on Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
The overall score can be better understood by looking at quantitative information (theme scores and activated criteria) and qualitative information (strengths and improvement areas).
A. Quantitative Information: Scores & Activated Criteria
Like the overall score, theme scores are on a scale of 1 to 100.

Each of the four themes (Environment, Labor & Human Rights, Ethics, Sustainable Procurement) have specific criteria associated with them. Because the questionnaire is customized by industry, size and location, not all 21 criteria are activated for every company and some criteria are weighted more heavily than others.
If certain criteria are not activated, then the specific associated issue is not relevant or has very low sustainabiliy risk for that company.
Medium importance criteria are the issues some sustainability risk is present but not the most pressing.
High importance criteria are the issues where the company faces the greatest sustainability risk.
Criteria classified as Only in Risk Countries are activated only if the company has significant operations in one or more countries identified as risky.
B. Qualitative Information: Strengths & Improvement Areas

Qualitative information provides more details and insights into a company's score. For each theme, the company is assigned strengths (elements of their sustainability management system that are positive) and improvement areas (elements of their sustainability management system that need to be improved). The strengths and improvement areas are divided according to the three management layers (Policies, Actions, Results) and are also classified by priority.

All improvement areas are automatically added to the company's Corrective Action Plan. They are pre-organized by priority. The Corrective Action Plan is a collaborative feature designed to support companies' performance improvement. It enables companies to build an improvement plan online, communicate planned and completed corrective actions and share feedback.

360° Watch Findings comprise relevant public information about companies' sustainability practices that have been identified via more than 10,000 data sources (including NGOs, press and trade unions). 360° Watch Findings are incorporated into the EcoVadis assessment and can have positive, negative or no score impact.
EcoVadis is connected to the following international sources:

- Sustainability networks and initiatives (e.g. AccountAbility, Business for Social Responsability, CSR Europe)
- Trade unions and employers’ organizations
- International organization (e.g. United Nations, European Court of Human Rights, Global Compact, International Labor Organization, World Bank)
- NGOs (e.g. China Labor Watch, Greenpeace, WWF, Movimento Difesa del Cittadino)
- Research institutes and specialized press (e.g. CSR Asia, Blacksmith Institute, Corpwatch)
Additional comments from our analysts pertaining to the assessment.
Any questions or need help? Visit our Help Center at support.ecovadis.com
Discover the primary sustainability risks, regulations, hot topics and best practices related to specific industries.

EcoVadis determines industry based on the International Standard Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), 
which is a compilation of all global economic activities published by the United Nations Statistical Commission. Its main purpose is to provide a set of activity categories that can 
be utilized for the collection and reporting of statistics according to such activities.

It is possible that a company has operations in more than one industry. In these cases, EcoVadis classifies companies based on their main area of operation, as determined by sustainability risk and/or total revenue.

toolkitDocs__CSRAssRepo__EV360WatchDescr: Learn more about 360° Watch. This key element of the rating process combines artificial intelligence with human analysis to identify the most relevant stories within the past five years, both positive and negative, collected from over 100,000 public sources. 360° Watch Findings are the output of this process, where the analyzed results are integrated as part of the EcoVadis Rating, and are displayed in the EcoVadis Scorecard.

You may also use it to answer other sustainability assessment requests from customers outside the EcoVadis network (e.g., Sedex, Achilles, custom questionnaires).

toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__ecoVadisMethodol: EcoVadis CSR Methodology Overview and Principles

The objective of the EcoVadis assessment methodology is to assess the quality of a company’s sustainability management system through its policies, actions, and results. The assessment focuses on 21 issues which are grouped into 4 themes: Environment, Labor & Human Rights, Ethics, and Sustainable Procurement.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__ecoVadisDocument: In order to assess a company’s sustainability performance, our analysts need evidence to support the answers given in the questionnaire. Please note that the documents provided should demonstrate the company’s sustainability management system, be relevant and complete, and relate to the scope of the assessment.

toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__eLearningText__0: Get started with sustainability and the EcoVadis assessment with this interactive e-learning tool. All courses are available in five languages: English, French, Spanish, Portuguese, and Chinese.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__introductionToCo: What is sustainability? What do your customers expect from you?
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__establishCSRMana: Why implement a Sustainability Management System? What are the main Sustainability Management System standards?Why implement a Sustainability Management System? What are the main Sustainability Management System standards?
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__ecoVadisCSRMonit: How does EcoVadis monitoring process work? How does global companies use the EcoVadis rating?
toolkit__UseRes_InDepCSRUnd__ecoVadisMet: Get an in-depth understanding of the EcoVadis methodology. For EcoVadis, an effective sustainability management system is composed of the following elements: Policies, Actions, and reporting on Results. Each of these elements carries a particular weight when calculating a company’s theme score. These three management layers are separated into seven management indicators: Policies (POLI), Endorsements (ENDO), Measures (MESU), Certifications (CERT), Coverage - deployment of actions (COVE), Reporting (REPO), and 360° Watch Findings (360).
toolkit__UseRes_InDepCSRUnd__howToGuides: This series of short and practical e-books provides further guidance on specific sustainability topics. Each guide addresses a particular improvement area in the scorecard, explaining the importance of the subject and the management indicator (Policy, Action, or reporting on Results). It also includes concrete examples and best practices for developing policies, actions, and reporting for particular sustainability topics.

toolkit__UseRes_InDepCSRUnd__maximizingY: Maximizing Your Sustainability Success: A Communications Guide for Companies Rated by EcoVadis
Discover our tips and best practices for promoting sustainability success via press releases, social media communications, testimonials, and more.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__csrRecognition: Your company hasn’t received a medal yet.

An EcoVadis Medal is awarded in recognition of your EcoVadis Rating when your company achieves an overall score of 47 or more with no low theme scores. When you receive a medal, you can share the news with others: include it on your website, in press releases, sales presentations, proposals and marketing materials. You can also add it to product documentation, packaging and other communications.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__EVRatingCertif: Your company hasn’t received a certificate yet.

An EcoVadis Rating Certificate is awarded in recognition of your EcoVadis Rating when your company achieves an overall score of 47 or more with no low theme scores. Print the certificate and display it in your office to show to your employees and visitors, or include it in your sales and communication materials.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__getStartedWithCS: Get started with sustainability and EcoVadis assessment with this interactive e-learning tool.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__thisCourseIsAvai: This course is available in 5 languages: English, French, Spanish, Portuguese and Chinese.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__TheEcoVadisProce:
Whether you are new to the EcoVadis program or just need a refresher, this video tutorial takes you
through the process step by step from a requesting company perspective. If you are a buyer, you will
find useful information on what actions to take at each phase of your EcoVadis sustainability journey.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__EcoVadisDirector: Inviting companies to the EcoVadis assessment is an essential part of your company’s sustainable supply chain initiative. The Directory feature enables you to invite an unlimited number of companies for an EcoVadis assessment at any point in time, directly from the EcoVadis platform.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__IntegratingSusta: This video tutorial is a full training mapping the EcoVadis platform features to your daily procurement processes such as RFPs, supplier reviews or market watch. The EcoVadis platform is designed for procurement teams as a project management tool.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__CollaboratingonS: Knowing your trading partners’ sustainability performance score is just the starting point of your company’s sustainable procurement initiative. The true value is to improve your suppliers’ performance and build a robust supply chain. This tutorial takes you through the EcoVadis platform features to start the improvement journey with your suppliers in a simple and efficient way.
toolkit__UseRes_CSRFun__TheEcoVadisQuest: This is the welcome video tutorial your trading partners see at registration on the EcoVadis platform. It explains in an easy-to-understand way how to go through the questionnaire, what type of information is relevant and why it is important to upload documents as evidence. Watch this video and get on the same level as the companies from which you ask for an EcoVadis assessment.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__MedalsNewDescr: A licensed high-resolution medal to promote your company’s sustainability rating and performance in the EcoVadis assessment. There are four levels: Platinum (approximately top 1 percent of rated companies), Gold (approximately top 5 percent), Silver (approximately top 25 percent) and Bronze (approximately top 50 percent).
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__NewEcoVadisMed: A licensed high-resolution medal to promote your company’s performance in the EcoVadis assessment. There are four levels: Platinum (approximately top 1 percent of rated companies), Gold (approximately top 5 percent), Silver (approximately top 25 percent) and Bronze (approximately top 50 percent). For information on current score requirements for EcoVadis Medals, see {articlelink}.

Share the news with others: include it on your website, in press releases, sales presentations, proposals and marketing materials. You can also add it to product documentation, packaging and other communications.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__NewEcoVadisRat: An official certificate of achievement to promote your company’s performance in the EcoVadis assessment. This is another communication tool to present your EcoVadis Rating accomplishment and promote your company's performance.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__carbonScorecar: This PDF version of your Carbon Scorecard summarizes the carbon management performance of your company across three management stages (Commitment, Actions, Reporting), based on your most recent assessment.
Feel free to share your Carbon Scorecard with stakeholders, such as employees, board members or NGOs, and in RFP or tender proposals.
toolkit__UseRes_ShaMyPer__tooltipNoCarbo: Your company hasn’t received a carbon scorecard yet. {Learn more} about who and how can get a carbon scorecard.

SubscriptionandBilling__SubBil_Sub_Upg__: Get started and benchmark your performance
Sustainability how-to guides & industry risk profile
Build and showcase your sustainability program
Unlimited scorecard sharing outside the EcoVadis network
Showcase your success: EcoVadis Medal (if eligible) and Rating Certificate
Protect brand reputation with Live News Monitoring
Highlight additional CSR and philanthropic activities (not part of assessment)
Carbon Calculator for Scope 1 and 2 emissions
Rate your own trading partners (up to 5)
Fast track your sustainability leadership status
Rate your own trading partners (up to 10)
Single point of contact for your program
Priority assessment to jump the queue
Upgrade to Select plan unavailable in platform. {ContactUsLink}
Manage group performance across all entities
View & manage all entities' scorecards from one dashboard
Free upgrade to Premium for all linked entities
Sustainability how-to guides & industry risk profile
EcoVadis Medal (if eligible) and Rating Certificate
Premium upgrade for all linked entities
Introductory courses only, up to 3 users
The EcoVadis questionnaire is customized to your industry, size and location.

The industry's most complete sustainability assessment with over 15+ hours of expert analysis from EcoVadis' team of sustainability pros, transforms your questionnaire and documents into a scorecard with your company’s rating of 0 - 100 on four themes, plus a list of strengths and improvement areas.
Benchmark and compare your company's EcoVadis Rating to your industry, across all sustainability criteria.

360° Watch Findings combine Artificial Intelligence with human analysis to identify the most relevant stories within the past five years, both positive and negative, collected from over 100,000 public sources and a third-party regulatory compliance database. 360° Watch Findings are analyzed and integrated as part of the EcoVadis Rating, and are displayed in the Scorecard. They can have a positive, negative, or neutral impact on a company's score.
Focused, prioritized guidance on building your sustainability profile and score in collaboration with your trading partners.

Report quantitative metrics on indicators like energy consumption, water use, waste recovery, carbon/GHG emissions, injury rates, and more. Track your performance  and improvement over time and provide additional transparency to your trading partners by choosing to share your data.
Detailed information on "best practices" profile examples and target Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for your company's industry sector.
Detailed knowledge base to get answers 24/7 at support.ecovadis.com.
All documents are stored in a secure and confidential repository as per our Confidentiality Commitment. You can select your sharing preferences with your trading partners.

An EcoVadis scorecard focused specifically on carbon management practices, the Carbon Scorecard provides companies of nearly any size, industry, and stage of the decarbonization journey with an easy to understand view of score performance and a clear action plan of prioritized improvement areas.

An easy to use tool to help calculate Scope 1 & 2 emissions from direct and indirect activities, the EcoVadis Carbon Calculator incorporates best-in-class data and is aligned with the most rigorous standards in carbon/GHG accounting. Users get a tool they can be confident calculates their emissions with the utmost relevance to their specific location, industry, and activity, in a process that can be immediately leveraged for tracking and reporting via the EcoVadis network. Available in English language only.
Get rated once, share everywhere. With Premium and Corporate share with anyone. With Basic, share within the EcoVadis network.

Help protect your reputation with live monitoring and alerts related to your company. In between assessments, stories related to your sustainability performance continue to be gathered in the form of Live News. Powered by the same smart engine as 360° Watch Findings, Live News stories are automatically reviewed and verified by EcoVadis analysts. Live News does not impact the current rating of a company. However, when a company is reassessed, archived Live News is used to complement 360° Watch Findings.

Get more visibility on the sustainability practices of your business operations and supply chain and improve your own sustainable procurement practices by requesting ratings of your own trading partners and monitoring their performance over time.
Showcase your company’s non-assessed CSR activities in the areas of philanthropy, community involvement, and sustainability innovation and differentiate yourself further to your trading partners.
High-resolution renderings of your EcoVadis rating certificate and any medal earned (Platinum, Gold, Silver or Bronze), licensed and downloadable for display on your website and marketing materials.
Improve your sustainability knowledge, collaborate with customers, and improve your performance with relevant and actionable e-learning courses via EcoVadis Academy.
Expanded industry benchmarking from EcoVadis’ leading database of sustainability performance.
A one-hour briefing (conference call) with an analyst from EcoVadis expert team to explain all the details of your scorecard and improvement opportunities.
Your assessment jumps the queue and your EcoVadis Sustainability Scorecard is ready in 2-4 weeks after you submit.
After registration, we organize an orientation call to explain the EcoVadis methodology and answer your questions.
An analyst pre-fills your questionnaire with publicly available documents saving you valuable time and effort.
Consolidate and manage your subsidiaries’ EcoVadis accounts, with efficient tools for responding to assessment requests from your trading partners.
All subsidiaries linked to your Corporate account get upgraded to Premium for the price of the Basic service.
Easy, flexible payment system lets you pre-purchase vouchers that can be allocated to your subsidiaries’ subscriptions.
The support team is ready to answer your questions in 10 languages, online or by phone.

Commitment by rated companies to achieve GHG emissions reduction. It consists of quantitative GHG emissions reduction target(s), strategic action plan and necessary resources supported by the high level management to enable the accomplishment of the commitment. While there is no specific reduction level required by Carbon Rating, the rated companies should determine and align their commitment with one of the goals of the Paris Agreement: "keeping the increase in the global average temperature to well below 2°C above pre-industrial levels and pursuing efforts to limit the temperature increase to 1.5°C above pre-industrial levels."
Time-bound GHG emissions reduction targets based on the emissions baseline
A series of actions or process improvements planned in order to achieve GHG emissions reduction targets. Strategic plan to decarbonize or transition to low-carbon business model
Specific management structure to facilitate climate action and GHG management within the organization

A series of actions implemented to reduce GHG emissions within the range of the rated companies’ business activities, including engagement with its value chain. It mimics “Do”: implement and control what was planned. At this stage, actions should be done to reduce direct and indirect GHG emissions from companies' operations as well as other indirect emissions from their business partners along the value chain (i.e. suppliers). In case the residual emissions still remain after the rated companies have sought all viable actions to reduce the emissions from operations, the rated companies should formulate responsible approach to eliminate the residual emissions.
Implementation of actions or process modifications to achieve GHG emissions reduction
Influencing suppliers to reduce GHG emissions along value chain

Includes two elements: monitoring and review of GHG emissions. Effective monitoring is a complete and accurate tracking of the GHG emissions performance level within the operational boundary of the organization. The rated companies should demonstrate that all the material GHG emissions sources and activities data have been well monitored. Finally, to assess the progress against the commitment, companies conduct regular review of the effectiveness of GHG emissions reduction actions, and identify improvement to ensure the GHG emissions reduction target achievement as per the committed timeline.
Data collection system to keep track of activities used for GHG emissions calculations
The extent to which the GHG emissions monitoring system is deployed across the organization
Regular GHG data collection from the value chain to account for Scope 3 emissions
Regular performance review to assess progress towards GHG emissions reduction targets
Publication of GHG emissions performance report to ensure transparency to relevant stakeholders
